snippet: North Korea’s surprise launching of a satellite on Wednesday prompted the United States, Japan and South Korea to demand further sanctions.
abstract: United States and its Asian allies begin effort to impose additional sanctions on North Korea after its largely successful rocket launching; allied nations also ad warning to China that its failure to rein in North Korea will result in even greater American military presence in Pacific.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and William J. Broad from New York. Choe Sang-hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: North Korea’s surprise launching of a satellite on Wednesday prompted the United States, Japan and South Korea to demand further sanctions.

headline.seo: North Koreans Launch Rocket in Defiant Act
headline.main: After Rocket Launching, a Call for New Sanctions
headline.print_headline: After Rocket Launching, Call for New Sanctions
